So yes, the S&P500 is close to all time highs, but has done F-all (technical term) over the past 20 months, and global has been dismal.  Being "close to ATH" when the market has basically range-traded for 2 years means a lot less than if it were up say 53% (as it was in Jan 18).
Across that same period: -The S&P500 is up 4% (1% below 26/07/2019 ATH) -MSCI EM is down -17% (USD) [-10% local] -MSCI World Ex-US -12% (USD) [-4% local]

"but the stockmarket is near all time highs!"  That is a factual piece of information.   Here are some other facts: Since the initial peak on 26 Jan 2018 the MSCI ACWI (local currency terms) is down -1%   (that's -1% across 627 days, that's not good, it's not frothy, not bubbly)
